name: cloudcode
description: Cloud Code is Google Cloud's official IDE extension to develop with your favorite Google Cloud services such as Kubernetes, Cloud Run, Cloud APIs, Containers, Google Cloud Build. Cloud Code makes developing with Google Cloud (GCP) feel like working on local code.

cloudcode.debug-kubernetes.description: Provide customizations for the Cloud Code debuggers.

suppressNETCoreWarning.description: If true, suppress .NET Core debug warning.

suppressJavaWarning.description: If true, suppress Java debug warning.

suppressPythonWarning.description: If true, suppress Python debug warning.

suppressNodeJSWarning.description: If true, suppress Node JS debug warning.

suppressGoWarning.description: If true, suppress Go debug warning.

configPath.description: Full path to the KubeConfig file.

cloudcode.kubeconfigs.markdownDescription: List of KubeConfig files that can be used in the Kubernetes Explorer. Switch between the default KubeConfig and KubeConfigs listed here with the `#cloudcode.active-kubeconfig#` setting.

cloudcode.active-kubeconfig.markdownDescription: Name of the active KubeConfig used by the extension. This name should match the name of a KubeConfig stored in `#cloudcode.kubeconfigs#`. If a name isn't provided, the default KubeConfig will be used.

cloudcode.enableExperimentalDeploymentWi.description: Enable the experimental deployment wizard that streamlines the deployment for existing kubernetes applications.

cloudcode.beta.enableOutputLogging.description: Enable the new Output Logging for kubernetes and cloud run run/debug sessions.

cloudcode.beta.enableBuildEnvironmentsIn.description: Enable setting up Build Environments on run/debug/deploy sessions.

cloudcode.beta.enableIterativeDebugging.description: Enable iterative debugging with skaffold dev.

cloudcode.enableDeployDebugV2.description: Enable the new deploy and debug flows.

cloudcode.enableMultiSkaffoldConfigsKey.description: Enable support for multiple skaffold configurations.

cloudcode.enableTelemetry.markdownDescription: Enable sending usage data to Google. Data collected is subject to the [Google Privacy Policy](https://policies.google.com/privacy).

cloudcode.updateAdcOnLogin.markdownDescription: Append a `â€”-update-adc` flag to `gcloud auth login`. [Read about this flag](https://cloud.google.com/sdk/gcloud/reference/auth/login#--update-adc).

cloudcode.updateChannel.markdownDescription: Automatically install the insiders version of Cloud Code by changing this value to 'Insiders', or set the value as 'Default' to use the stable released version from the marketplace. [Learn more about Insiders builds](https://cloud.google.com/code/docs/vscode/insiders).

cloudcode.enableMinikubeGcpAuthPlugin.markdownDescription: Enable the [minikube gcp-auth plugin](https://minikube.sigs.k8s.io/docs/handbook/addons/gcp-auth/) when starting a Cloud Code run or debug session that is deploying to minikube.

cloudcode.enableConfigLessExperience.markdownDescription: Enable the experimental config-less run/debug experience for Kubernetes and Cloud Run apps.

cloudcode.yaml.trace.server.description: Trace the communication between VSCode and the language server in an output window.

cloudcode.yaml.schemas.description: Associate schemas to YAML files in the current workspace.

cloudcode.yaml.format.singleQuote.description: Use single quotes instead of double quotes.

cloudcode.yaml.format.bracketSpacing.description: Print spaces between brackets in objects.

enumDescriptions: Wrap prose; if it exceeds print-width.
Never wrap; keep prose on the same line.
cloudcode.yaml.format.proseWrap.description: Choose when to automatically wrap prose.

cloudcode.yaml.customTags.description: Custom tags the parser should recognize and validate against.

cloudcode.yaml.clusterResourceCompletion.description: Enable resource completions from the active cluster. This setting may impact completion performance.

cloudcode.yaml.yamlFileMatcher.markdownDescription: Glob pattern matching YAML files in the workspace. YAML editing support such as completion, inline definitions, and linting would be available for this file type. Read more about glob patterns [here](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/codebasics#_advanced-search-options).

cloudcode.yaml.enableMigrateForAnthosSup.description: Enable Migrate for Anthos YAML editing support.

cloudcode.yaml.kubernetesVersion.description: Select the Kubernetes version Cloud Code should utilize when providing YAML editing support.

cloudcode.yaml.crdSchemaLocations.markdownDescription: Array of locations pointing to Kubernetes CRD schema. Each of these can be set to a local path (example: `/files/crd.yaml`) or URL (example: `http://github.com/user/repo/crd.yaml`).

cloudcode.cloudshell.project.markdownDescription: Default project to use in Cloud Shell. If not set, the existing default will be used or you will be prompted to set one. For more information on how to get started with developing in a Cloud Shell environment, view this [quickstart](https://cloud.google.com/code/docs/vscode/quickstart-remote-dev).

cloudcode.aws.description: Provide customizations for Amazon Elastic Container Service for Kubernetes (Amazon EKS) support in Cloud Code.
cloudcode.aws.deprecationMessage: We are deprecating first class support for EKS clusters. Please use eksctl directly.

cloudcode.awsExplorerVisible.description: Display the Amazon EKS cluster explorer.

cloudcode.azureExplorerVisible.description: Display the Azure Kubernetes Service cluster explorer.

cloudcode.autoDependencies.markdownDescription: Automatically install and update required Cloud Code dependencies such as the [Cloud SDK](https://cloud.google.com/sdk/gcloud), [Skaffold](https://skaffold.dev/), [minikube](https://minikube.sigs.k8s.io/docs/), and [Kubectl](https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/kubectl/overview/).

cloudcode.verboseLogging.description: Display extension debug information in the 'Cloud Code' output window.

cloudcode.minikubeStatusBar.description: Display minikube status in the status bar.

repoUrl.description: Git path pointing to the repository

localPath.description: Folder where the sample repository has been stored locally

cloudcode.customApplications.description: List of custom samples in Cloud Code

cloudcode.enableGkeAutopilotSupport.markdownDescription: Enable deployment support for GKE-Autopilot clusters

cloudcode.enableCrashReporting.description: Enable reporting unexpected Cloud Code crashes to Google

emulatorHost.description: Host name or IP address where the Apigee Emulator is running

language.description: Programming language of the application being debugged.

debugPort.description: Debug Port used on the container.

remoteRoot.description: Absolute path to the remote directory containing the program
remoteRoot.default: Path to the Remote Directory Containing the Program

podSelector.description: Selector to choose debugging pod. Usually a dictionary where key is app and value is the name of the deployment will suffice. See https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/labels/ for more information.

localRoot.description: Path to the local directory containing the program

containerName.description: Name of the container to be debugged. This field will only be used if more than one container is found in the pod.

skaffoldConfig.description: Path to the skaffold configuration file used for running the app.

profile.description: Name of the skaffold profile. Remove this field to use the default profile.

imageRegistry.description: Image registry to push the container images to. For example, gcr.io/{Google Cloud Project ID} or docker.io/{Repository Name}

watch.description: Watches for changes in the workspace and re-runs the application. Defaults to true.

cleanUp.description: Deployed kubernetes resources will be cleaned up after the application is terminated. Defaults to true.

autoStop.description: Minikube clusters started automatically by Cloud Code will stop after the user is done with the extension. Defaults to true.

portForward.description: Forwards ports for exposed kubernetes resources on the cluster to your local machine. Defaults to true.

resourceDeletionTimeoutMins.description: Timeout in minutes for skaffold to wait on resource deletions before redeploying.

image.description: The name of the container image.

sourceFileMap.description: Path mapping used by the debugger. The key is the local path and the value is the path on the remote container.

debug.description: An array of image names and their respective source paths mapped from a local source. Any additional fields will be passed along to the respective language debugger. For example, justMyCode for the Python debugger.

language.description: Programming language of the application being debugged.

debugPort.description: Debug Port used on the container.

remoteRoot.description: Absolute path to the remote directory containing the program
remoteRoot.default: Path to the Remote Directory Containing the Program

podSelector.description: Selector to choose debugging pod. Usually a dictionary where key is app and value is the name of the deployment will suffice. See https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/labels/ for more information.

localRoot.description: Path to the local directory containing the program

containerName.description: Name of the container to be debugged. This field will only be used if more than one container is found in the pod.

protocol.description: Node.js option: debug protocol to use

justMyCode.description: Python option: debug only user-written code.

cpu.description: Container CPU limit. Limit is expressed as a number of CPU. Fractional CPU limits are allowed (e.g. 1.5).

build.description: Build Settings. Specify one of [docker, jib, buildpacks].

buildArgs.description: Arguments passed to the docker build

jibMaven.description: Builds image using the Jib Maven Plugin

path.description: Build file path. Ex: pom.xml, .mvn directory

jibGradle.description: Builds image using the Jib Gradle Plugin

path.description: Build file path. Ex: build.gradle, gradle.properties, settings.gradle or the Gradle wrapper script (gradlew, gradlew.bat, or gradlew.cmd)

buildpacks.description: Builds image using Cloud Native Buildpacks

target.description: Target to run the app. Only minikube is currently supported.

watch.description: Watches for changes in the workspace and re-runs the application. Defaults to true.

autoStop.description: Minikube clusters started automatically by Cloud Code will stop after the user is done with the extension. Defaults to true.

sourceFileMap.description: Path mapping used by the debugger. The key is the local path and the value is the path on the remote container.

externalPortForward.markdownDescription: When this is set, Cloud Code will port forward a version of the service to `0.0.0.0` so it is accessible to other devices on the network. This is useful for debugging your service on mobile devices.

configurationSnippets.label: Cloud Code: Run/Debug Cloud Run App
configurationSnippets.description: Configuration for running and debugging a Cloud Run app locally

view/item/context.when: view == cloudcode.kubectlExplorer && viewItem == kubeGenericCollection || view == cloudcode.kubernetes.localDevExplorer && viewItem == kubeGenericCollection
view == cloudcode.kubectlExplorer && viewItem == kubeResource || view == cloudcode.kubernetes.localDevExplorer && viewItem == kubeResource

view == cloudcode.kubectlExplorer && viewItem =~ /kube(System|AutoGkeSystem)?DeploymentObject/ || view == cloudcode.kubernetes.localDevExplorer && viewItem =~ /kube(System|AutoGkeSystem)?DeploymentObject/
view == cloudcode.kubectlExplorer && viewItem =~ /kube(System|AutoGkeSystem)?PodObject/ || view == cloudcode.kubernetes.localDevExplorer && viewItem =~ /kube(System|AutoGkeSystem)?PodObject/
view == cloudcode.kubectlExplorer && viewItem == kubeIngressObject || view == cloudcode.kubernetes.localDevExplorer && viewItem == kubeIngressObject
view == cloudcode.kubectlExplorer && viewItem == inactiveKubeNamespace || view == cloudcode.kubernetes.localDevExplorer && viewItem == inactiveKubeNamespace
view == cloudcode.kubectlExplorer && viewItem == kubeContainer || view == cloudcode.kubernetes.localDevExplorer && viewItem == kubeContainer
view == cloudcode.kubectlExplorer && viewItem == kubectlIPObject || view == cloudcode.kubernetes.localDevExplorer && viewItem == kubectlIPObject
view == cloudcode.kubectlExplorer && viewItem == kubeSecretNode || view == cloudcode.kubernetes.localDevExplorer && viewItem == kubeSecretNode
view == cloudcode.kubectlExplorer && viewItem == kubeEvent || view == cloudcode.kubernetes.localDevExplorer && viewItem == kubeEvent
view == cloudcode.kubectlExplorer && viewItem == kubeConfigKeyNode || view == cloudcode.kubernetes.localDevExplorer && viewItem == kubeConfigKeyNode
view == cloudcode.kubectlExplorer && viewItem == kubeConfigMapNode || view == cloudcode.kubernetes.localDevExplorer && viewItem == kubeConfigMapNode
view == cloudcode.kubectlExplorer && viewItem =~ /kube(AutoGke)?NodeObject/ || view == cloudcode.kubernetes.localDevExplorer && viewItem =~ /kube(AutoGke)?NodeObject/
view == cloudcode.kubectlExplorer && viewItem == kubeResource || view == cloudcode.kubernetes.localDevExplorer && viewItem == kubeResource
view == cloudcode.kubectlExplorer && viewItem =~ /kube(AutoGke)?NodeObject/ || view == cloudcode.kubernetes.localDevExplorer && viewItem =~ /kube(AutoGke)?NodeObject/
view == cloudcode.kubectlExplorer && viewItem == inactiveKubeNamespace || view == cloudcode.kubernetes.localDevExplorer && viewItem == inactiveKubeNamespace

view == cloudcode.kubectlExplorer && viewItem =~ /kube(System|AutoGkeSystem)?DeploymentObject/ || view == cloudcode.kubernetes.localDevExplorer && viewItem =~ /kube(System|AutoGkeSystem)?DeploymentObject/
view == cloudcode.kubectlExplorer && viewItem =~ /kube(System|AutoGkeSystem)?PodObject/ || view == cloudcode.kubernetes.localDevExplorer && viewItem =~ /kube(System|AutoGkeSystem)?PodObject/
view == cloudcode.kubectlExplorer && viewItem == kubeIngressObject || view == cloudcode.kubernetes.localDevExplorer && viewItem == kubeIngressObject
view == cloudcode.kubectlExplorer && viewItem == inactiveKubeNamespace || view == cloudcode.kubernetes.localDevExplorer && viewItem == inactiveKubeNamespace
view == cloudcode.kubectlExplorer && viewItem == kubeResource || view == cloudcode.kubernetes.localDevExplorer && viewItem == kubeResource

view == cloudcode.kubectlExplorer && viewItem =~ /kube(System|AutoGkeSystem)?DeploymentObject/ || view == cloudcode.kubernetes.localDevExplorer && viewItem =~ /kube(System|AutoGkeSystem)?DeploymentObject/
view == cloudcode.kubectlExplorer && viewItem =~ /kube(System|AutoGkeSystem)?PodObject/ || view == cloudcode.kubernetes.localDevExplorer && viewItem =~ /kube(System|AutoGkeSystem)?PodObject/
view == cloudcode.kubectlExplorer && viewItem =~ /kube(AutoGke)?NodeObject/ || view == cloudcode.kubernetes.localDevExplorer && viewItem =~ /kube(AutoGke)?NodeObject/
view == cloudcode.kubectlExplorer && viewItem == kubeIngressObject || view == cloudcode.kubernetes.localDevExplorer && viewItem == kubeIngressObject

view == cloudcode.kubectlExplorer && viewItem =~ /kube(AutoGke)?NodeObject/ || view == cloudcode.kubernetes.localDevExplorer && viewItem =~ /kube(AutoGke)?NodeObject/
view == cloudcode.kubectlExplorer && viewItem == kubeDeploymentCollection || view == cloudcode.kubernetes.localDevExplorer && viewItem == kubeDeploymentCollection
view == cloudcode.kubectlExplorer && viewItem == kubePodCollection || view == cloudcode.kubernetes.localDevExplorer && viewItem == kubePodCollection
view == cloudcode.kubectlExplorer && viewItem == kubeContainer || cloudcode.kubernetes.localDevExplorer && viewItem == kubeContainer

viewsWelcome.contents: Visible when a valid Apigee workspace is open

scripts.ci:postinstall: npm run compile:electron && cd ./src/webview && npm ci --ignore-scripts && npm run ci:postinstall && cd ../../third_party/yaml-language-server && npm ci --ignore-scripts
scripts.vscode:prepublish: npm run compile:prod && cd ./src/webview && npm run build && cd ../../third_party/yaml-language-server && npm run compile-prod && cd ../../ && npm run copy:markdowns
scripts.compile: cross-env NODE_OPTIONS=--max_old_space_size=8192 webpack --mode none && cd ./src/webview && npm run build && cd ../../third_party/yaml-language-server/ && npm run compile
scripts.compile:dev: cross-env NODE_OPTIONS=--max_old_space_size=8192 webpack --mode development && cd ./src/webview && npm run build:dev && cd ../../third_party/yaml-language-server/ && npm run compile
scripts.compile:nomaps: cross-env NODE_OPTIONS=--max_old_space_size=8192 webpack --mode none --maps bypass && cd ./src/webview && npm run build && cd ../../third_party/yaml-language-server/ && npm run compile
scripts.postinstall: npm run compile:electron && cd ./src/webview && npm install && cd ../../third_party/yaml-language-server && npm install
scripts.test: npm run test:extension && cd ./src/webview && npm run test && cd ../../third_party/yaml-language-server && npm run test
scripts.test:localdev: npm run copy-node-pty-binaries-from-vscode-test && npm run test
scripts.test:windows: npm run download-and-copy-node-pty-binaries-from-vscode-test && cross-env CODE_TESTS_PATH=$INIT_CWD/dist/test node ./dist/test/runTest.js && cd ./third_party/yaml-language-server && npm run test
scripts.test:ui:setup: cross-var extest setup-tests -c $npm_package_config_test_version && extest install-from-marketplace golang.go ms-python.python vscjava.vscode-java-pack ms-dotnettools.csharp
scripts.test:ui:insider:setup: extest setup-tests --type insider && extest install-from-marketplace --type insider golang.go ms-python.python vscjava.vscode-java-pack ms-dotnettools.csharp
scripts.pretest:ui:setup:deploy: npm run test:compile && npm run test:ui:setup
scripts.pretest:ui:setup:deploy:helloworld: npm run test:compile && npm run test:ui:setup
scripts.pretest:ui:setup:deploy:helloworld:jpn: npm run test:compile && npm run test:ui:setup
scripts.pretest:ui:setup:deploy:guestbook: npm run test:compile && npm run test:ui:setup
scripts.pretest:ui:setup:deploy:guestbook:jpn: npm run test:compile && npm run test:ui:setup
scripts.pretest:ui:setup:deploy:cloudrun: npm run test:compile && npm run test:ui:setup
scripts.pretest:ui:setup:deploy:cloudrun:jpn: npm run test:compile && npm run test:ui:setup
scripts.pretest:ui:setup:insider:deploy: npm run test:compile && npm run test:ui:insider:setup
scripts.pretest:ui:setup:insider:helloworld: npm run test:compile && npm run test:ui:insider:setup
scripts.pretest:ui:setup:insider:guestbook: npm run test:compile && npm run test:ui:insider:setup
scripts.pretest:ui:setup:insider:cloudrun: npm run test:compile && npm run test:ui:insider:setup
scripts.clean: gts clean && cd ./third_party/yaml-language-server && npm run clean
